trans-unit.source: When copying data from and to relational stores, you need to keep repeatability in mind to avoid unintended outcomes.
trans-unit.target: When copying data from and to relational stores, you need to keep repeatability in mind to avoid unintended outcomes.

trans-unit.source: Note: A slice can be re-run automatically in Azure Data Factory as per the retry policy specified.
trans-unit.target: Note: A slice can be re-run automatically in Azure Data Factory as per the retry policy specified.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to set a retry policy to guard against transient failures.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to set a retry policy to guard against transient failures.

trans-unit.source: Hence repeatability is an important aspect to take care of during data movement.
trans-unit.target: Hence repeatability is an important aspect to take care of during data movement.

trans-unit.source: In most cases when reading from relational stores, you would want to read only the data corresponding to that slice.
trans-unit.target: In most cases when reading from relational stores, you would want to read only the data corresponding to that slice.

trans-unit.source: A way to do so would be by using the WindowStart and WindowEnd variables available in Azure Data Factory.
trans-unit.target: A way to do so would be by using the WindowStart and WindowEnd variables available in Azure Data Factory.

trans-unit.source: Read about the variables and functions in Azure Data Factory here in the <linkText>Scheduling and Execution</linkText><title></title> article.
trans-unit.target: Read about the variables and functions in Azure Data Factory here in the <linkText>Scheduling and Execution</linkText><title></title> article.

trans-unit.source: The above query will read data from ‘MyTable’ that falls in the slice duration range.
trans-unit.target: The above query will read data from ‘MyTable’ that falls in the slice duration range.

trans-unit.source: Re-run of this slice would also always ensure this behavior.
trans-unit.target: Re-run of this slice would also always ensure this behavior.

trans-unit.source: In other cases, you may wish to read the entire Table (suppose for one time move only) and may define the sqlReaderQuery as follows:
trans-unit.target: In other cases, you may wish to read the entire Table (suppose for one time move only) and may define the sqlReaderQuery as follows:
